Package it.polimi.ingsw.view

Class ActionSender

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.ActionSender
Direct Known Subclasses:
CLIActionSender, GUIActionSender
public abstract class ActionSender
extends java.lang.Object
Class responsible of sending user interactions to the server.

      Parameters:
      gameConfig - the file containing the configurations

    • selectLeaders

      public void selectLeaders​(java.util.List<java.util.UUID> leaderCards, java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.util.List<Resource>> selectedResources)
      Selects the leader cards that will be kept and the initial resources to pick.
      Parameters:
      leaderCards - a list of the uuids of the leader cards that will be kept
      selectedResources - a map containing the deposit rows associated to the chosen resources for that row

    • buyDevelopmentCard

      public void buyDevelopmentCard​(int cardIndex, int slotIndex)
      Buys the DevelopmentCard selected from the deck.
      Parameters:
      cardIndex - the index of the card to buy
      slotIndex - the slot in which the card will be put in

    • draw

      public void draw​(int marketIndex, java.util.List<Resource> whiteConversions)
      Choose a column or row of Marbles in the Market and take all the Resources displayed in the chosen column or row, each Market Marble indicates a Resource.
      Parameters:
      marketIndex - the index representing the row or column to drawn
      whiteConversions - special leader ability that when you take Resources from the market, each white Marble in the chosen row or column gives you the indicated Resource

    • discard

      public void discard​(int cardIndex)
      Discards a Leader : you can discard a Leader Card from your hand to receive one Faith Point.
      Parameters:
      cardIndex - the index of the card to discard

    • move

      public void move​(int row1, int row2)
      Moves the Resources in your deposit: you can move Resources in your depots in any way during your turn. Swaps the resources in {@param row1} and {@param row2}.
      Parameters:
      row1 - the index of the row of your deposit to be moved
      row2 - the index of the row of your deposit where {@param row2} will be moved

    • storeMarketResult

      public void storeMarketResult​(int resourceIndex, int rowIndex)
      Places the Resources taken from the Market in the deposit with the exception of Faith Points, which are registered on the faith Track. The deposit is divided in three depots of 1,2, or 3 slot each. You can place only one type of Resource in a single depot. You can't place the same type of Resource in two different depots. In other words each depot must have the same Resource and all depots must have different Resource.
      Parameters:
      resourceIndex - thh index representing the Resource to store
      rowIndex - the index representing the row of the deposit where the Resource will be stored

    • endTurn

      public void endTurn()
      Ends the current turn, usable only if the local player is currently playing. Also this will be prevented if the local player has queued productions.

    • setActive

      public void setActive​(int cardIndex)
      Activates a LeaderCard: If you satisfy the requirement of a Leader Card in your hand, you can play that LeaderCard. It will give you a special ability for the rest of the game.
      Parameters:
      cardIndex - the index of the LeaderCard to set active

    • useLeaderProduction

      public void useLeaderProduction​(LeaderCard leaderCard, Resource desiredResource) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Adds the the production ability of a LeaderCard to the queue. This ability gives you an additional production power. When you activate the production, you can freely use this power as usual. You will receive a Resource of your choosing and 1 Faith Point.
      Parameters:
      leaderCard - the card to be used
      desiredResource - the desired Resource of your choosing to receive
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • useDevelopmentProduction

      public void useDevelopmentProduction​(DevelopmentCard developmentCard) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Adds the production ability of a DevelopmentCard to the queue. Every Development Card has a production power. When you activate the production, you can pay the Resources required to receive the Resources given by the LeaderCard.
      Parameters:
      developmentCard - the DevelopmentCard to use
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • useBaseProduction

      public void useBaseProduction​(java.util.List<Resource> inputResource, java.util.List<Resource> outputResource)
      Adds the base production ability to the queue. The basic production power allows you to pay 2 Resources of any type (even 2 different Resources) to receive 1 Resource of your choosing.
      Parameters:
      inputResource - a List representing the Resources needed to activate the base production.
      outputResource - a Resource representing the output of the base production.

    • executeProductions

      public void executeProductions() throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Checks if the development productions and the base productions in the queue can be executed and, if so, executes them.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • sendChatMessage

      public void sendChatMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      Sends a given message to all the players.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to send
